FOUND IN: Tango - A passionate and dramatic partnered dance originating from Argentina, known for its intricate footwork and close embrace between dancers.
Defy - To refuse to obey; challenge openly and boldly.
Theatrette (historically used term in French-speaking regions for surgery room)
Tuning fork (used as an objective pitch standard in music)
Restriction - Limiting or controlling something that needs to be decreased or reduced, such as dietary restrictions for health reasons.
Eggy - describes the flavor or consistency reminiscent of eggs, often used to describe foods like omelettes that prominently feature cooked eggs as a key ingredient.
Composer - Both Gustav Mahler and Alban Berg are considered prominent composers who were part of the early German Romantic period.
Dove - Symbolizing peace, love, and purity in various cultures.
